entry.title: International Game Technology Slots (igtslots)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat


IGT, short for International Game Technology, is a renowned casino industry player. Based in Nevada, IGT boasts decades of experience catering to casino enthusiasts. They specialise in designing, developing, and producing slot machines, casino games, and gaming software for online and mobile platforms. Collaborating with legal casinos, IGT is a global leader offering innovative gaming solutions worldwide.

Their physical slot machines are user-friendly, flexible, and incorporate the latest technological advancements.

The package includes:

2041 games (~21 GB)

Go to download   

Notes:

If you have a mouse connected to your system, you can use that to move the cursor and insert coins, press buttons etc.

If however you only have a gamepad, we have added mappings so the analogue stick moves the mouse and button A (south) is left click.

Hotkey + start will close the emulator

Some machines will have a welcome/info message box appear when you start them, these can be closed by doing the following:

- RetroBat: Use the mouse to click in the X in the top right corner of the box.

- Batocera: As the emulator runs under Wine, the message boxes don't have the top bar and X in the top right corner. So we have mapped Y (north) to the Escape key, so press this once to close the message box. You may then find that the main emulator window loses focus (becomes inactive), to get round this, we have mapped alt-tab to X (west), press this once and the main window will become active again.

Normally the fruit machines open in the middle of the screen with large black borders. The emulator doesn't support bezels/decorations, so we have used ReShade to add a bezel to either side of the screen.

**Important note for RetroBat**

The emulator stores it's settings in the registry, to apply the correct settings, please add these settings BEFORE running any fruit machines. We have provided these here:

\Retrobat\roms\igtslots\fruitmach.pc\Import-Settings.reg

Just double-click on the file and accept the prompts to import the settings.

How to install:
Drag and drop the contents of the "v1-RGS_igtslots" into the '/roms/igtslots/' folder and Enjoy!

entry.title: Sega Hikaru (hikaru)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat

 

The Sega Hikaru is a successor of the Sega NAOMI and Sega Model 3 arcade systems that was developed in 1998 and debuted in 1999. The Hikaru was used for a handful of deluxe dedicated-cabinet games, beginning with 1999's Brave Fire Fighters, in which the flame and water effects were largely a showpiece for the hardware.

It was significantly more powerful and expensive than the NAOMI. The Hikaru featured a custom Sega GPU with advanced graphical capabilities, additional CPU and sound processors, various custom processors, increased memory, and faster bandwidth. It was the first game platform capable of effective hardware Phong shading, the most intensive form of shading at the time, and was capable of the most complex lighting and particle effects of its time.

It was the most powerful game system of its time (Planet Harriers, for example, was regarded as having the best video game graphics at the time), but it was very expensive and difficult to program. Since it was comparatively expensive to produce, Sega soon abandoned the Hikaru in favor of continued NAOMI development. It was succeeded by the more affordable NAOMI 2.

The package includes:

6 games (~755 MB)

Go to download   

Notes:
This is version 2.0 with refreshed/updated artworks.
This pack was never released as a standalone pack, but was included in the original base build.

How to install:
1. If you have a previous version of this pack, delete the contents of /roms/hikaru/

2. Drag and drop the contents of the "v2-RGS_hikaru" folder into the /roms/hikaru/ folder.
(Create the folder is it doesn't exist)

3. Enjoy!

entry.title: Computer Art Visual Entertainment (cave)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat


CAVE Interactive Co., Ltd. is a Japanese video game company founded in 1994 by former employees of Toaplan following its bankruptcy. They are known primarily for their "bullet hell" shoot 'em ups; from 1995 up to 2013, CAVE was one of the most prolific shoot 'em up developers in the Japanese market. Alongside this, CAVE has produced a variety of other types games for arcades, home consoles, PCs, and smartphones, also dating back to 1995.

"CAVE" is an acronym for "Computer Art Visual Entertainment".

The package includes:

39 games (~2,7 GB)

Go to download   

Notes:

This v2.0 pack has updated/refreshed artwork along with updated versions of the ROMs

RetroBat:

The game "Deathsmiles II: Makai no Merry Christmas" is the Windows version of the game. To run it successfully, you will need to set the emulator to "Windows".

Run the PixN Update Service to get the updated config file for this system, then follow the steps below:

- Highlight the game in the wheel,
- Hold the A (south) button to open the options menu,
- Select "Advanced Game Options",
- Set the emulator to "Windows",
- Exit back out of the menus.

How to install:
1. If you have have an older version of this pack, delete the old roms first.

2a. RetroBat: Drag and drop the contents of the "v2-RGS_cave3rd" folder into the /roms/cave/ folder.

2b. Batocera: Drag and drop the contents of the "v2-RGS_cave3rd" folder into the /roms/cave3rd/ folder.

3. Enjoy!

entry.title: UNIS Arcade Machines (unis)
entry.content:
for Batocera only


UNIS Technology is a leading developer and manufacturer of coin-operated arcade games, known for their innovative and engaging designs.

With over 30 years of experience, UNIS has created a wide range of arcade games that cater to various interests and age groups.

The package includes:

6 games in pack for Batocera (~15 GB)

Pack for Batocera   

Batocera pack NOTE:
Requirements: minimum RGS Batocera v42 with latest PiXN script updates (check discord how to update), a modern GPU or iGPU with 4GB vram, sadly we don't recommend Intel iGPU. (check discord how to update)

Q: What is Arcade PC?
A: Arcade PC games are modern arcade games not playable with MAME, such as the BlazBlue series.

Q: Is this Teknoparrot?
A: Not quite. Teknoparrot is only a game launcher, and unfortunately, it does not work on Batocera/Linux.

Q: How does it work?
A: Launching Arcade PC games in Batocera is achieved using JConfig through Wine.

Q: What are JConfig and Wine?
A: JConfig is not just a program for launching recent arcade games; it includes a wide collection of launchers, tools, emulators, and patched executables for a better "arcade at home" experience. Wine enables Windows games/applications to run on Linux (Batocera).

Q: Does this sound complicated? Should we be worried?
A1: No need to worry! We've packaged the games to launch on most systems (Intel i5 / AMD Zen1).

Q: Is there anything else we need to know?
A: Yes, a few minor details:

- Most lightgun games require an actual lightgun (e.g., Sinden).
- Some lightgun games can be played with a mouse (a mouse indicator icon is present in the wheel).
- All games use a custom Wine GE runner and manual pad2key made by SPiRiT! (That is why this pack only works on RGS Batocera update)
- A lot of Boxart is fictional as these games does not have boxart, missing boxart is custom created by G-spawn! ty ty!

Games:
After Dark
Crazy Ride
Elevator Action Invasion
Night Hunter
Raccoon Rampage
Wicked Tuna

How to install Batocera pack:
1. Drag and drop the contents of the "v1-RGS_unis_batocera" folder into the '/roms/unis/' folder.
2. Enjoy!

entry.title: Microsoft Xbox Live Arcade (xbla)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat

 

Xbox Live Arcade (XBLA) was a digital video game distribution service available on the Xbox 360 console. It offered a wide variety of downloadable games, ranging from classic arcade titles to innovative indie games.

XBLA provided gamers with an easy way to discover and play new games, often featuring unique and creative gameplay experiences.
It was known for its affordable pricing and frequent promotions, making it a popular choice for gamers looking to expand their library with diverse and entertaining titles.

The package includes:

719 games (~490 GB)

 Download   

 

How to install:
1. Inside the 'Xbox Live Arcade' folder you have a 'roms' folder and 'saves.zip' file.

2. From the 'roms' folder, copy the 'xbla' folder to your 'roms' folder:

Batocera: /userdata/roms/
RetroBat: /RetroBat/roms/

3. From the 'saves.zip' file, extract the '0000000000000000' folder to:

Batocera: /userdata/saves/xbox360/
RetroBat: /RetroBat/saves/xbox360/xenia/content/

4. Enjoy!

Notes:
- This is a COMPLETE collection based on the No-Intro set.
- The only games removed are duplicates where the set had demo and full versions of a game, we have kept just the full version.
- The ROMpack has a 100% complete artwork set: 2D Boxart, 3D Boxart, Image, Logo, Fanart and Video Snap.
- The '0000000000000000' folder contains all the DLC, Addons and Updates for all games.

entry.title: SNK Neo Geo MVS (neogeomvs)
entry.summary:
for Batocera and Retrobat
Version: 25th July 2025
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat
Version: 25th July 2025

 

The Neo Geo MVS, stylised as NEO•GEO MVS, also written as NEOGEO MVS, is a coin-operated arcade machine released in 1990 by Japanese game company SNK Corporation. Its CPU is technically a 16/32-bit 68000-based system with an 8/16-bit Z80 coprocessor, while its GPU chipset has a 24-bit graphics data bus.

The MVS offers owners the ability to put up to six different cartridges into a single cabinet, a unique feature that was also a key economic consideration for operators with limited floorspace, as well as saving money long-term. With its games stored on self-contained cartridges, a game cabinet can be exchanged for a different game title by swapping the game's ROM cartridge and cabinet artwork.
The Neo Geo MVS was a worldwide commercial success upon release in arcades, becoming one of the highest-earning machines at various arcades across markets.

A home console version was also made, called Advanced Entertainment System (AES). Unlike earlier systems, the Neo Geo AES was intended to reproduce the same quality of game as the arcade MVS system.

The package includes:

147 games (~5,5 GB)

Go to download   

Note:
Make sure you have run the PixN Update Service to get the new custom config to make this MVS specific set show up. Previously we had NeoGeo and NeoGeoMVS both using the same ROMs, but we've now split them and made them 2 separate packs as there are some difference between the 2 sets. They also have their own sets of artwork. Run the PixN Update Service (for either Batocera or RetroBat) and it will add the new config file for the new separate MVS system. Then download and copy over the MVS ROMs folder.

How to install:
If it exists, delete the "neogeomvs" folder from the 'roms' directory,
Drag and drop the "neogeomvs" folder into the 'roms' directory,
Enjoy!

- Use this rompack if you update RGS v39 to minimum v40

entry.title: Namco System 246 & 256 (namco2x6)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat



The Namco 2x6 is part of Namco's System 2 arcade hardware series, which was prominent during the late 1980s and early 1990s. The "2x6" configuration within this series represents a more advanced setup, capable of handling enhanced graphical and audio performance compared to earlier models.

This system was used in several iconic arcade games, leveraging its improved processing power to deliver smoother gameplay and richer visual experiences. The Namco 2x6 helped solidify Namco's reputation for innovation in the arcade industry, supporting the development of more complex and engaging gaming experiences.

The package includes:

51 games (48 and 3 hidden) (~43 GB)

Go to download   

Requirements:
Latest RetroBat or Batocera with latest RGS Update script Batocera (41.69) RetroBat (v1.43)

Note:
Both RetroBat and Batocera use modified versions of the Play! emulator, but some games still have graphical or audio glitches. We had to hide these three games because they are currently unplayable (a future update may render them playable):

Battle Gear 3
Battle Gear 3 Tuned
Umi Monogatari Lucky Marine Theater

For RetroBat the default Emulator is Play! but you can also use the Teknoparrot Launcher with a handful of games, all the profiles have been tested and setup on R:\RetroBat

Games supported are by the Teknoparrot launcher are: 

bldyr3b

How to install:
Drag and drop the "namco2x6" folder into the 'roms' directory and Enjoy!

entry.title: Microsoft Windows (windows)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat

 

Microsoft Windows, commonly referred to as Windows, is a group of several proprietary graphical operating system families, all of which are developed and marketed by Microsoft. Each family caters to a certain sector of the computing industry.

Active Microsoft Windows families include Windows NT and Windows IoT; these may encompass subfamilies, e.g. Windows Server or Windows Embedded Compact (Windows CE). Defunct Microsoft Windows families include Windows 9x, Windows Mobile and Windows Phone.

The package includes:

1446 games (~1,73 TB)

Go to download   

NOTE:
This pack is handcrafted by Ransom & Kazai – with mad respect to “The Legendary Amok.”

After the work of Ransom and his brother Kazai, the Windows games have been converted to .wsquashfs format by our very own SPiRiT! Awesome job on making this pack available for Batocera. SPiRiT also tested all the games on our RGS Batocera build.

.wsquashfs is fully supported on both Batocera and RetroBat. However, there is one thing you need to know: on RetroBat, a .wsquashfs file will be decompressed when first started. You’ll see a nice progress bar — so far, so good. In EmulationStation (the RetroBat menu), you can choose an option to KEEP the decompressed file so that when you start it a second time, the game will instantly boot up.

Keep in mind that for larger games, the decompression process on RetroBat can take up to 30 minutes! On Batocera, this is not an issue because .wsquashfs is natively supported.

On RetroBat, for larger games, it may seem like RetroBat has frozen… but just wait — it will eventually decompress and boot your game.

How to install:
Drag and drop "windows" folder to your Batocera \share\roms or R:\Retrobat\roms folder.

entry.title: Namco System 22 (namco22)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat



The Namco System 22 is the successor to the Namco System 21 arcade system board. It debuted in 1992 with Sim Drive in Japan, followed by a worldwide debut in 1993 with Ridge Racer.

The System 22 was designed by Namco with assistance from graphics & simulation company Evans & Sutherland. Graphical features include texture mapping, Gouraud shading, transparency effects, and depth cueing, thanks to the Evans & Sutherland 'TR3' chip/chipset, which stands for: Texture Mapping, Real-Time, Real-Visual, Rendering System. The main CPU provides a scene description to the TR3 graphics processing unit and a bank of DSP chips which perform 3D calculations.

A variant of the system, called the Super System 22, was released in 1995. The hardware was largely similar to the System 22, but with a slightly higher polygon rate and more special effects possible.

The package includes:

18 games (~404 MB)

Go to download   

How to install:
Drag and drop the "namco22" folder into the 'roms' directory and Enjoy!

entry.title: Namco System 11 (namco11)
entry.content:
for Batocera and Retrobat



The Namco System 11 is a 32-bit arcade system board developed jointly by Namco and Sony Computer Entertainment. Released in 1994, the System 11 is based on a prototype of the PlayStation, Sony's first home video game console, using a 512 KB operating system and several custom processors.

The Namco System 12 is an upgraded version of the System 11 that was released in 1996, featuring faster processing power.

The package includes:

9 games (~192 MB)

Go to download   

How to install:
Drag and drop the "namco11" folder into the 'roms' directory and Enjoy!
